channel.description: it won't let anybody log into my server but me? I used utorrent and followed the linksy tut

item.title: Connection
item.dc:creator: @zzjimmy zzjimmy
item.description:
@zzjimmy wrote:

[quote=“starbeast199, post:10, topic:413048”][quote author=zzjimmy link=topic=514521.msg3735155#msg3735155 date=1314904604]

it won’t let anybody log into my server but me?
I used utorrent
and followed the linksy tut

I had the same problem as you and I might have figured something out. When i was trying to host on my it open?internet it didn’t work even if i unblocked all of the ports and disabled my firewall and antivirus etc. so i wanted to see if my friend could host it for me. It didnt work for him either. Then we used his neighbours internet and it finally worked. now idk if this is true but both of our internet sources were WEP and required passwords and the other one was OPEN and it didn’t require passwords or anything. So maybe if you change your internet to OPEN and allowed it to be public it might work. Now idk if this is correct but that’s what i have so far. I hope this helps
[/quote]

how do i open it?[/quote]

uhhhh i actually didn’t want to open mine because i don’t want people using my bandwidth but its your choice. for me (windows7) i went on control pannel/network and internet/view network status and tasks then i clicked on my connection then i went on properties, then security and it should give you an option if you want to make it “open”

Read full topic

item.title: Connection
item.dc:creator: @starbeast199 starbeast199
item.description:
@starbeast199 wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:11, topic:413048”][quote author=zzjimmy link=topic=514521.msg3735155#msg3735155 date=1314904604]

it won’t let anybody log into my server but me?
I used utorrent
and followed the linksy tut

I had the same problem as you and I might have figured something out. When i was trying to host on my internet it didn’t work even if i unblocked all of the ports and disabled my firewall and antivirus etc. so i wanted to see if my friend could host it for me. It didnt work for him either. Then we used his neighbours internet and it finally worked. now idk if this is true but both of our internet sources were WEP and required passwords and the other one was OPEN and it didn’t require passwords or anything. So maybe if you change your internet to OPEN and allowed it to be public it might work. Now idk if this is correct but that’s what i have so far. I hope this helps
[/quote]

This sounds plausible.

Go to Control Panel > Network and Sharing.

Do you have a “public network”?
[/quote]

yes i believe i have public network because i can go on my internet without putting a password in
i have windows xp

Read full topic

[quote=“zzjimmy, post:9, topic:413048”][quote author=starbeast199 link=topic=514521.msg3735061#msg3735061 date=1314898061]
it won’t let anybody log into my server but me?
I used utorrent
and followed the linksy tut
[/quote]

I had the same problem as you and I might have figured something out. When i was trying to host on my internet it didn’t work even if i unblocked all of the ports and disabled my firewall and antivirus etc. so i wanted to see if my friend could host it for me. It didnt work for him either. Then we used his neighbours internet and it finally worked. now idk if this is true but both of our internet sources were WEP and required passwords and the other one was OPEN and it didn’t require passwords or anything. So maybe if you change your internet to OPEN and allowed it to be public it might work. Now idk if this is correct but that’s what i have so far. I hope this helps :([/quote]

This sounds plausible.

Go to Control Panel > Network and Sharing.

Do you have a “public network”?

item.title: Connection
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Disable your firewall and all anti virus programs. Make sure there’s no possible way anything can be blocking it.

Check and re-check you haven’t misspelled anything: compile it, check again and re-check.

It’s an obvious mistake, obviously, that doesn’t appear to be too obvious.

Read full topic

item.title: Connection

item.description:

its spelt right and
Success: I can see your service on _______________ on port (43594)
Your ISP is not blocking port 43594
